issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: This doesn't comply with our wiki: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/StatsDev#StatsDev-Examples
fields.summary: Describe table doesn't show num of partitions

comments.body:

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12860884 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
seems like qfile needs updating. Also, can you create a RB with updated golden files.

Update golden files. All the diff is adding the numPartition stats, which is expected.
The code change is to compute the number of partitions as we iterate all the partitions. It also changes how we aggregate the stats, so that we only go through the partitions once, because iterating over partitions could be expensive.
[~ashutoshc], I've put patch v2 on RB. Could you take a look? Thanks.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12861028/HIVE-16315.2.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to 2 failed/errored test(s), 10540 tests executed

Tests exited with: TestsFailedException: 2 tests failed

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12861028 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
[~ashutoshc], the latest failures are of age 15 and not related.
Pushed to master and branch-2. Thanks [~ashutoshc] for the review.

Hi [~lirui] [~ashutoshc] I had a question regarding this patch. Is there a reason why we need to calculate the numPartitions every time we issue a describe command? Can we possibly reuse the cached value from the table properties?

Hi [~vihangk1], sorry that I overlooked your comment. Although we set the properties to the table after we compute all the statistics, I don't think it's cached anywhere. I also tried the CachedStore introduced in HIVE-16520, but seems only what's in the underlying DB is cached. So the runtime-computed values still need to be recomputed. Please let me know if I missed anything. Thanks.
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
